listitem.para:
how many bytes can be sent/received on the inbound or outbound SA of a particular instance of a connection (a set of encryption/authentication keys for user packets) , from successful negotiation to expiry; acceptable values are an integer optionally followed by KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB or EiB to signify kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, terabytes, petabytes or exabytes. The default is 2^63 bytes.
Normally, the connection is renegotiated (via the IKE SA) before ipsec-max-bytes value is reached. This option is not negotiated and both ends use their own value for this option.

The value set two triggers. The number of bytes allowed to be encrypted with the same key, ie hard expire and a soft limit. The soft limit is 50% of ipsec-max-bytes + random value derived using rekeyfuzz that will slightly prefer an initiator over a responder so that hopefully the original initiator will keep initiating. An IPsec SA contains two keys, a key for inbound and outbound traffic. Thus a value of 1GiB means a rekey is triggered when either inbound or outbound traffic hits the configured value. These values are not added up.
